student_essay: This paper provides a critical evaluation of the 2018 study by Burgoyne and colleagues, titled Evaluation of a parent‐delivered early language enrichment programme: evidence from a randomised controlled trial. Following an overview of the study’s motivation, aim and hypotheses, I will evaluate these alongside the results, adherence to open data conventions, as well as the overall efficacy of the intervention. In conclusion, I will propose that while the intervention showcases promising results, further investigation is needed to broaden the scope of its applicability.
